```{r}
# Load necessary library
library(sf)

# Read the CSV file into R
# Replace 'your_file.csv' with the path to your CSV file
spreadsheet <- read.csv("C:/Users/Oren/Nardi_workspace/Tech/OFO/StemMaps/Data/703_Triton/Data/TrackingSheet/703_Triton.csv")

# Convert the data frame to an sf object
# Specify the columns containing the X and Y coordinates
sf_object <- st_as_sf(spreadsheet, coords = c("X_Corrected", "Y_Corrected"))

# Optionally assign a CRS if needed (e.g., WGS84)
# Uncomment the line below to assign CRS
 sf_object <- st_set_crs(sf_object, 4326)

# Write the sf object to a GeoJSON file
# Replace 'output_file.geojson' with your desired file name
st_write(sf_object, "output_file.geojson", delete_dsn = TRUE)

# Save as GeoJSON
st_write(sf_object, "C:/Users/Oren/Nardi_workspace/Tech/OFO/StemMaps/Data/703_Triton/Data/Projected_CSV/triton703.geojson", delete_dsn = TRUE)

# Save as Shapefile
st_write(sf_object, "C:/Users/Oren/Nardi_workspace/Tech/OFO/StemMaps/Data/703_Triton/Data/Projected_CSV/triton703.shp", delete_dsn = TRUE)
```
